intro: Aconitopsis barbata, commonly known as the hairy aconitopsis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in racemes. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rocky areas. Due to its toxic alkaloids, it is considered a hazardous plant to handle.
